page.title: 15TRANSPORT AROUND SHAWHEAD
page.content: Transport is a problem in the country. There are not many bus services around Shawhead. The bus leaves Shawhead at 8.20am and arrives back at 4.20pm. The bus usually carries school children and workers but not shoppers. As public transport is not very good cars are vital. Bicycles are good for the children to play on and go to school on. They are handy if you are stuck for transport. Most families have 1 or 2 cars. Farmers are never really stuck for transport as they have tractors, vans and Land Rovers. Lots of farmers wives shop on a Wednesday when their husbands are at the market in town. The roads in winter are not very good since we are high up and get more snow than the town. The back roads are not priority for snow ploughs.
